meanings.sent1: After one glass of wine, she felt squiffier than usual.
meanings.sent2: The squiffier he got, the louder he sang at the karaoke bar.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked squiffier than the dog after drinking spilled milk.
meanings.sent4: The room spun around her, making her feel squiffier with each passing moment.
meanings.sent5: His squiffier state was evident in his slurred speech and unsteady gait.

meanings.sent1: The picture frame looked even squiffier after the earthquake.
meanings.sent2: She tried to straighten the crooked painting, but it only ended up squiffier.
meanings.sent3: The wonky table leg made the whole furniture set look squiffier.
meanings.sent4: The tower leaned squiffier than the famous leaning tower of Pisa.
meanings.sent5: The crooked sign made the entrance look squiffier than the exit.
